entries.femaleVariant: Hey, hey! I'm Josh Kavorkin, and as always, Your Business is My Business!
We'll kick off the day with a broad scan of the market. Kiroshi climbs two, Quadra dips by one, New American Autoworks revs up by one and a half...
But the day's big head-turner? Orbital Air rocketing by TEN points! Don't touch that volume, you heard right! Ten points!
But why? How? Coming off a disappointing year, no new announcements, the release of long-time CEO Leslie Wawuda... Who could justify even an enny of investment into the stagnant aerospace giant?
And yet... Don't forget, folks â€“ many huge accounts out there are managed by AIs. You blink an eye and they've already bought and sold shares twice over in billion-eurdollar deals.
The problem is we don't always know what drives their decisions. And frankly, the owners of the funds they manage couldn't care less so long as they see those profits ticking up.
But, my dear viewers, I say we dig deeper. How could Orbital Air grow so drastically so quickly?
My friends, I see only one logical explanation. Those AIs expect  a big boost in demand for orbital flights in the very near future.
But why? World war? Environmental catastrophe? Perhaps the rise of the machines?
That we may never know. Whatever conclusion the AIs have deduced from their data crunch they seem intent on keeping it to themselves.
Regardless of our fates, the time to buy is now. After all, we may need the windfall to buy our tickets to the moon once the world finally goes to hell! Hahahaha!
